body:
BUILTIN(TypedArrayPrototypeIncludes) - builtins/builtins-typed-array.cc
Preconditions/guards snippet:
- ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(array, JSTypedArray::Validate(isolate, args.receiver(), method_name)); // ValidateTypedArray checks receiver is JSTypedArray
- if (args.length() < 2) return false; // need search element
- int64_t len = array->GetLength(); if (len == 0) return false;
- index handling: ToInteger on arg[2], CapRelativeIndex to clamp negatives
- DirectHandle<Object> search_element = args.atOrUndefined(isolate,1);
- ElementsAccessor* elements = array->GetElementsAccessor(); Maybe<bool> result = elements->IncludesValue(isolate, array, search_element, index, len);
- MAYBE_RETURN(result, exception)
- Returns ToBoolean(result)
Explanation: TypedArray includes delegates to the ElementsAccessor implementation after Validate/length/index checks. ElementsAccessor implementations perform typed-array-specific checks (detached/RAB/OOB) and SameValueZero semantics. This builtin also handles BigInt typed arrays by converting search element appropriately in other builtins; here it passes through the raw object to the accessor.
explanation: Describes the C++ builtin entry for %TypedArray%.prototype.includes; shows validation, argument handling, and delegation to ElementsAccessor->IncludesValue which contains typed-array fast-paths and detached checks.
